alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:42AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Fayette and southeastern Lamar Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 542 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Belk, or 8 miles northeast of Millport, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayette, Millport, Berry, Kennedy, Belk, Ashcraft Corner, Bankston, Bevill State College Fayette, Cody, Stone Wall, Richard Arthur Field and Fayette County Public Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
